results.title: The Helping hand
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Visatone (Australia)
results.brief_description: Three new-Australians tell of the moment when they felt accepted in Australia and how they have worked to fit in with the local way of living. English lessons at Cooma are shown and finally a naturalization ceremony in a Sydney suburb.

results.title: Helpem Mifala: aid for Solomon Islands
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Australian Agency for International Development
results.brief_description: Examines Australia’s aid scheme to the Solomon Islands which became independent in 1978. As well as financial aid, technical and medical advisors are assisting the Islands in their development. Photographer - Dean Semler; editor - Sue Horsley; sound - Bob Hayes.

results.title: Helpers: personalising the instruction of reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Louise Henry, KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.) and Veriation Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the use of supportive personnel in individualising instruction and meeting the needs of students. Illustrates the process used to prepare teachers to work with volunteers, and the professional relationship which exists between the principal, teachers and volunteers.

results.title: Help wanted: secretary
results.brief_description: A good secretary requires a state of mind that goes beyond the basic secretarial skills. Three situations in which bad secretarial practices are demonstrated are seen and are followed by a short restatement of the desired qualities of a good secretary.

results.title: Help me find myself
results.brief_description: Gerard Kennedy explains cerebral palsy, of which spasticity is one form. The film shows children and adults utilising their abilities to lead as normal a life as possible.

results.title: Help is
results.creator_credit: Ross McConnell and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: First aid at the roadside - a clear demonstration of what the first person, or persons, on the scene of a motor vehicle accident should do during those critical minutes before ambulance and police arrive. A comprehensive film, dealing not only with on-the-spot treatment of injuries, but with the individual responsibility of every motorist in today’s total traffic picture. It was produced with the counsel of federal and provincial medical and traffic authorities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ross McConnell and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Helicopter management: fire
results.brief_description: The helicopter is widely used in all phases of forest fire control in America. This training film is designed to assist personnel in planning, organising and directing helicopter operations safely and efficiently.

results.title: Helen Keller in her story
results.creator_credit: Richard Carver Wood, Nancy Hamilton and Butterfield and Wolf Inc
results.brief_description: This inspiring film received an Academy Award for the best feature documentary of 1956, A biography of Helen Keller, it traces her life from her birth to her mid seventies - when this documentary was made. As a small child, she was left totally blind and deaf by an illness. For years she was cut off from the rest of the world, until Ann Sullivan taught her to read braille, read lips and talk. This film shows excerpts from the silent docudrama: “Deliverance” in which she starred. Also contains the only newsreel footage of Ann Sullivan. Narrated by Katherine Cornell. Music by Morgan Lewis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Carver Wood, Nancy Hamilton and Butterfield and Wolf Inc
results.description: This inspiring film received an Academy Award for the best feature documentary of 1956, A biography of Helen Keller, it traces her life from her birth to her mid seventies - when this documentary was made. This film shows excerpts from the silent docudrama: “Deliverance” in which she starred. Also contains the only newsreel footage of Ann Sullivan. Narrated by Katherine Cornell. Music by Morgan Lewis.

results.title: The Hela cell strain: cervical carcinoma
results.brief_description: Part of the Living Human Cells in Culture series. The film is introduced with a sequence of tissue preparation for photography, and then shows the physiological characteristics of Hela cells, a malignant strain of cervical origin. Among the processes shown are cell drinking, nuclear rotation, mitosis and the action of filapodia in intercellular communications.
